page.title: 16SACRISTON PIT P1
page.content:
This article focuses on the fate of Sacriston colliery and looks at working practices through the eyes of a miner.
The end of an era has come with the closure announcement of the last Coal Board mine in West Durham with the loss of over 200 jobs.
Sacriston Colliery ,which has only one working face and still uses pit ponies underground to pull the tubs to the shaft bottom ,Will close because of what the National Coal Board terms " abnormal geological conditions ."
Thirty men have applied for redundancy already and the number is expected to be eighty by the end of the year when the pit will shut.
